name: American Games Shows Online Trivia | TV Mixture | 20 Questions

questions.text: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire?: The 15 questions asked of a contestant are worth increasing amounts of money. Most are worth double the previous question's value. What question value is NOT double the previous question's (do not use dollar signs in the answer)?
questions.explanation:
300 & 500 & 125000.

	$300 is only worth 50 percent more than $200; $500 is only 66.6 percent more than $300; $125,000 is 95 percent more than $64,000.

questions.text: What game show had celebrity couples answer on how they thought their spouse's would reply to risque questions, with prize money being split between the audience in the red, yellow (banana), and blue sections?
questions.explanation:
Tattletales.

	Hosted by Bert Convy, who occasionally became a panelist with his wife.

questions.text: What game show had married couples playing a modified version of Blackjack against each other?
questions.explanation:
Gambit.

	Hosted by Wink Martindale

questions.text: What game show had the winner choose one of three cars with a key in the ignition; if the car started, it was theirs?
questions.explanation:
Split Second.

	Hosted by Tom Kennedy

questions.text: Of the various incarnations of the $__,000 Pyramid, what amount was NOT a title amount?
questions.explanation:
$75,000.

	Most famously hosted by Dick Clark

questions.text: What scandalized game show was the subject of the movie 'Quiz Show'?
questions.explanation:
21 & twenty-one & twenty one.

	Brought back in 2000 with Maury Povich as host

questions.text: What game show popularized the phrase, 'No Whammies!'?
questions.explanation:
Press Your Luck.

	Hosted by Peter Tomarken

questions.text: In the 1999-2000 TV season, 4 nighttime games shows appeared to compete against each other for ratings. Interestingly, 3 of the 4 are produced by the same man. Which one wasn't?
options: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire?
questions.explanation:
Twenty-one.

	Dick Clark produced the other three.

questions.text: Ironically, what was the first prize offered on the 1972-presents version of 'The Price is Right'?
questions.explanation:
fur coat.

	The host, Bob Barker, went on to become an animal-rights activist (anti-fur and pro-neutering) and a vegetarian.

questions.text: What game show had a single man or woman asking a hidden panel of 3 women or men questions in order to choose which to go on a date with?
questions.explanation:
The Dating Game.

	Some future celebrities that were contestants: Colleen Camp, Farrah Fawcett, Sally Field, George Foreman, Mark Harmon, Phil Hartman, Gregory Hines, Don Johnson, Andy Kaufman (as Baji Kimran), Steve Martin, Michael Richards, John Ritter, Bob Saget, Arnold Schwarzenegger, and Tom Selleck.

questions.text: Who created 'Jeopardy!'?
questions.explanation: Merv Griffin.

questions.text: Alex Trebek has hosted all of the following except
questions.explanation:
The $20,000 Pyramid.

	Yes, $20,000 was a pyramid prize amount, as were 10, 25, 50, and 100 thousand.

questions.text: What do Jack Narz (host of 'Beat The Clock' amongst others) and Tom Kennedy ('Split Second' and others) have in common besides being game show hosts?
options: They both substitute hosted the Miss America pageant
They both turned down hosting American Bandstand
questions.explanation:
They are brothers.

	Tom Kennedy's real name is Jim Narz. Their brother-in-law is Bill Cullen, host of several other game shows.

questions.text: What show did Bill Cullen last host before his death in 1990?
questions.explanation:
The Joker's Wild.

	From 1984-86

questions.text: Besides being an announcer for various game shows, for what non-game show has Don Pardo been an announcer for 25 years?
questions.explanation: Saturday Night Live & SNL.

questions.text: Weird Al Yankovic did a parody song about not playing well on what game show?
questions.explanation:
Jeopardy! & jeopardy.

	'I Lost On Jeopardy', sung to '(Our Love's in) Jeopardy' by Greg Kihn

questions.text: Alex Trebek provided the voice of 'Alan Quebec', a game show host, for a story on this popular animated show:
questions.explanation:
Rugrats.

	Didi Pickles (Melanie Chartoff) was a contestant on the quiz show Quebec hosted.

questions.text: What 'Today' host also hosted 'Sale of the Century'?
questions.explanation: Joe Garagiola.

questions.text: What Woody Allen movie did Regis Philbin have a part in?
questions.correct: Everything You Always Wanted to Know About Sex
questions.explanation: Everything You Always Wanted to Know About Sex.

questions.text: Name one of three game shows based on the children's game "Tic Tac Toe".
questions.correct: Tic Tac Dough & Hollywood Squares & Storybook Squares
questions.explanation:
Tic Tac Dough & Hollywood Squares & Storybook Squares.

	"Hollywood Squares" and "Storybook Squares" were shot on the same set with many of the same actors.  For "Storybook Squares", the actors played fairy tale characters instead of themselves, and the contestants were children.  "Tic Tac Dough" was a variation that had random topics come up in the unchosen squares.
